segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 4
segments.en: Linked Discourses 4

segments.pli: 3. Tatiyavagga
segments.en: 3. Māra

segments.pli: 22. Samiddhisutta
segments.en: 22. With Samiddhi

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sakkesu viharati silāvatiyaṃ.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sakyans near Silāvatī.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā samiddhi bhagavato avidūre appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharati.
segments.en: Now at that time Venerable Samiddhi was meditating not far from the Buddha, diligent, keen, and resolute.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmato samiddhissa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
segments.en: Then as Venerable Samiddhi was in private retreat this thought came to his mind,

segments.pli: “lābhā vata me, suladdhaṃ vata me,
segments.en: “I’m so fortunate, so very fortunate,

segments.pli: yassa me satthā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho.
segments.en: to have a teacher who is a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha!

segments.pli: Lābhā vata me, suladdhaṃ vata me,
segments.en: I’m so fortunate, so very fortunate,

segments.pli: yvāhaṃ evaṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajito.
segments.en: to have gone forth in a teaching and training so well explained!

segments.pli: Lābhā vata me, suladdhaṃ vata me,
segments.en: I’m so fortunate, so very fortunate,

segments.pli: yassa me sabrahmacārino sīlavanto kalyāṇadhammā”ti.
segments.en: to have spiritual companions who are ethical and of good character.”

segments.pli: Atha kho māro pāpimā āyasmato samiddhissa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya yenāyasmā samiddhi tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmato samiddhissa avidūre mahantaṃ bhayabheravaṃ saddamakāsi, apissudaṃ pathavī maññe undrīyati.
segments.en: And then Māra the Wicked, knowing what Samiddhi was thinking, went up to him and made a terrifyingly loud noise close by him. It seemed as if the earth was shattering.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā samiddhi yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno āyasmā samiddhi bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Samiddhi went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened. The Buddha said,

segments.pli: “idhāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato avidūre appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharāmi.
Tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
‘lābhā vata me, suladdhaṃ vata me,
yassa me satthā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho.
Lābhā vata me, suladdhaṃ vata me,
yvāhaṃ evaṃ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajito.
Lābhā vata me, suladdhaṃ vata me,
yassa me sabrahmacārino sīlavanto kalyāṇadhammā’ti.
Tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, avidūre mahābhayabheravasaddo ahosi, apissudaṃ pathavī maññe undrīyatī”ti.
“Nesā, samiddhi, pathavī undrīyati.
segments.en: “Samiddhi, that’s not the earth shattering.

segments.pli: Māro eso pāpimā tuyhaṃ vicakkhukammāya āgato.
segments.en: That’s Māra the Wicked come to pull the wool over your eyes!

segments.pli: Gaccha tvaṃ, samiddhi, tattheva appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharāhī”ti.
segments.en: Go back to that same place, Samiddhi, and meditate, diligent, keen, and resolute.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā samiddhi bhagavato paṭissutvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” replied Samiddhi. He got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before leaving.

segments.pli: Dutiyampi kho āyasmā samiddhi tattheva appamatto ātāpī pahitatto vihāsi.
segments.en: And for a second time Samiddhi was meditating in that same place, diligent, ardent, and resolute.

segments.pli: Dutiyampi kho āyasmato samiddhissa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa … pe …
segments.en: And for a second time he had the same thought …

segments.pli: dutiyampi kho māro pāpimā āyasmato samiddhissa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya … pe …
segments.en: and Māra made an earth-shattering noise.

segments.pli: apissudaṃ pathavī maññe undrīyati.
Atha kho āyasmā samiddhi māraṃ pāpimantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: Then Samiddhi addressed Māra the Wicked One in verse:

segments.pli: “Saddhāyāhaṃ pabbajito,
segments.en: “I went forth out of faith

segments.pli: agārasmā anagāriyaṃ;
segments.en: from the lay life to homelessness.

segments.pli: Sati paññā ca me buddhā,
segments.en: My mindfulness and wisdom are mature,

segments.pli: cittañca susamāhitaṃ;
segments.en: my mind is serene in immersion.

segments.pli: Kāmaṃ karassu rūpāni,
segments.en: Make whatever illusions you want,

segments.pli: neva maṃ byādhayissasī”ti.
segments.en: it won’t bother me.”

segments.pli: Atha kho māro pāpimā “jānāti maṃ samiddhi bhikkhū”ti dukkhī dummano tatthevantaradhāyīti.
segments.en: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The mendicant Samiddhi knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.

suttaplex.blurb: Māra repeatedly pesters the monk Samiddhi when he is on retreat. The Buddha encourages him, until eventually Samiddhi is able to recognize Māra for himself.
